name: TheAtlantic
text: “There’s almost no importance in talking about record-breaking events anymore, when talking about fires in California,” a climate scientist tells @yayitsrob, “because we’ve broken all the records so many times that … what do they even mean anymore?” https://t.co/7zHzW15HAV

name: TheAtlantic
text: Because of the Electoral College, "Biden has no incentive to run up his margin in three reliably blue states" @PeterBeinart writes. "Instead, he’s singularly focused on purple ones in the Midwest." https://t.co/E7n466dXtx

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Just as today we say the names of the many who have been unjustly killed by police officers, the names of those four girls became part of the call for change that energized social protests in the 1960s," Freeman A. Hrabowski III writes: https://t.co/AX7d0w4Y86

name: TheAtlantic
text: For the past four years, Britain has struggled against the heft of the EU as it seeks a new relationship with the bloc. The upshot is that London is now staring at a diplomatic defeat that would have seemed almost unimaginable before, writes @tommctague. https://t.co/v3nMtWMz4H

name: TheAtlantic
text: Bunkers let you believe what you want to believe, and comfort yourself against the horrors of that belief, alone and underground, @AnnieLowrey reports. Business is booming. https://t.co/7aCJLClEAh
